page.description: The a5w_label_saveas() method prints LayoutName to file in PDF, HTML, RTF, or TXT formats. If no format is specified, the PDF format is used. If a label needs to get access to global variables defined in a .a5w page, you must call this function, and not Label.SaveAs()
page.syntax: Result as C = a5w_label_saveAs(C LayoutName [,C Saveas_format [,C Filter [,C Order [,C Filename [,P globalVariables [,* PrintOptions [,* Arguments [,* Options ]]]]]]]])

argument.name: Saveas_format
argument.description: Character, type of tile to create (PDF/Excel/HTML/RTF/Text)

argument.name: Filter
argument.description: Filter expression to apply to label. Character

argument.name: Order
argument.description: Order expression to apply to report detail.

argument.name: globalVariables
argument.description: A pointer to the global variables. See [a5w_report_saveas()] for more details.

argument.name: PrintOptions
argument.description: PDF Driver options. See [Report.SaveAs()] for more details.

argument.name: Arguments
argument.description: Optional SQL Arguments (if required by the label datasource). See [Report.SaveAs()] for more details.

page.discussion: *[xb:A5w_label_saveas]* is the method to call to generate a Label from the Application Server.

link.href: /Ref/Api/Functions/Printable Layouts/Report Functions/A5W_report_saveas Function.xml#section1_Global Variables in Web Applications
